oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Managing the Risk of Cryptosporidium on Dairy Farms in Watersheds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nydam, D. V.
Wade, S. E.
Mohammed, H. O.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cryptosporidium parvum
protozoan
zoonotic
management
cost-effective
therapy
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cryptosporidium parvum is a coccidian protozoan that many published reports designate as the most prevalent organism isolated from diarrheic dairy calves. It is also zoonotic, potentially contaminating the environment with infective oocysts. To control this pathogen on dairy farms, rational and cost-effective measures need to be implemented. This study evaluated several management and therapeutic interventions for cost-effectiveness.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2001; 192
